extendedIngredients.original: 1 bunch broccoli rabe, trimmed, peeled, and thinly sliced crosswise

title: Stir-fried Broccoli Rabe
summary: Stir-fried Broccoli Rabe might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs 46 cents per serving. Watching your figure? This gluten free, whole 30, and vegan recipe has 45 calories, 2g of protein, and 4g of fat per serving. If you have sriracha, garlic, salt, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is a very affordable recipe for fans of Mediterranean food. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 7 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 73%. This score is pretty good. Try Orecchiette with Broccoli Rabe and Fried Chickpeas, Porcini-fried Rapini (broccoli Rabe), and Crisp-Fried Noodles with Barbecued Pork and Broccoli Rabe for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Italian can be paired with Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. The Felsina Berardenga Chianti Classico ( Half-bottle) with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Felsina Berardenga Chianti Classico ( Half-bottle)
productMatches.description: "Shows fresh berry, with hints of flowers, fresh herbs and chocolate. Full-bodied, with a fresh palate, well-integrated tannins and a balanced finish. Lots of cherry and light spice. Best after 2003."-Wine Spectator
